abstract.t: The CLUE protocol is an application protocol conceived for the description and negotiation of a CLUE telepresence session. The design of the CLUE protocol takes into account the requirements and the framework defined, respectively, in [I-D.ietf-clue-framework] and [I-D.ietf-clue-telepresence-requirements]. The companion document [I-D.kyzivat-clue-signaling] delves into CLUE signaling details, as well as into the SIP/SDP session establishment phase. We herein focus on the application level perspective. Message details, together with the behavior of CLUE participants acting as Media Providers and/or Media Consumers, are discussed.
